result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alex T. Volz

Review hearing on July 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary Hearing on August 3, 2022 at 09:20 am.

No contact with victim(s):  D.G.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (3) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk:  Amy. 
Called:  2:42 p.m. 
State appears by ADA Ben Verchinski.   Defendant appears in custody, via Zoom Video, and with Atty Vanessa Avila (spec appr). 

Date and time set for initial appearance. 
Atty Avila advises deft is in quarantine in jail and has not met with defendant.  
Defendant wishes to proceed to IA today; COURT advises right of counsel. 
Reading Waived.  Deft on PO hold. 

BOND:  $5000.00 cash bond.  

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): D.G. 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 3 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.  

RH:  7/29/22 at 1:00 p.m. 
PH:  8/03/22 at 9:20 a.m., Branch 6. 

Adj: 2:47 p.m. 

Branch 4.

Clerk: Marisa; Case called: 2:08 pm

Date and time set for initial appearance.

Deft requests counsel.
